column4: Ok, So when I use putty to ssh to my ubuntu server the program 'mc' always looks messed up. This is specific to ubuntu, because with the same exact putty config and same environment variable it works fine on: BSD, slackware and somethign called prox. Why does ubuntu trash my ascii?
for doing what you might ask?
can't you use the ssh command?
ill go ask a slackware user, bet they know why ubuntu borks the ascii char set
i dont, but many in this channel do
that was the most retarded line of answers ive ever got to a question
did not even attempt to help me
I helped you like 8 times :  USE THE SSH COMMAND
unless you have a good reason for using putty, which is why you were asked about your use case
